Fields.DialogueText: Captain, you got a second?
Of course. Something wrong?
It's about our Belle. Did I do something to offend her, or is she just...
... Like that?

Fields.MenuText: Yeah, no, she's got a stick up her ass.
It's not you, it's her.
Have you talked to her about it? What did she say?

Fields.DialogueText: I tried, but she froze me out.
That's about what I thought, but I wanted to make sure.
... Sounds about right.
My best guess is, she has a problem with your background.
... That little jerk.
Listen, not that it would matter if I was, but. I'm *not a Jew*. My folks are Catholic as the Pope.
You want me to talk to her?
I'll try first. But I wanted to make sure I wasn't... too off-base.
*ALARM*
You weren't. Get to your station!
Aye aye.
@BATTLE
My what now?
Well, your surname. She found out you're from New York rather than from Germany.
I'm not the only one, though. I mean, we've got recruits from all over - I was just talking with a girl from New Mexico.
I'll be blunt. Somebody speculated that somebody from your zip code with your surname stood a good chance of being Jewish as opposed to "proper Aryan," and Deutschland didn't take it well.
Neither did her friends in the OKM, for that matter.
I've ordered her to be professional. I gather she mostly has been?
I guess.
Grr... das ist sinnlos!
Who pissed in your breakfast?
Odin, or perhaps Saga.
The god of wisdom, huh? Did you do something you lived to regret?
He's also the Gott der Dichtung. And I cannot get the Skript to work.
Oh, you're talking about your opera again. I can listen if you like.
I don't have the music for this aria yet. I'm still working on the plot and the words.
Well, when you need help, let me know.
It's just one of those days. Nothing is coming out right.

Fields.MenuText: When that happens, it's time for a break.
Maybe you've got something on your mind?
That's always the worst. You have my sympathies.

Fields.DialogueText: Danke, but I don't need them. I need inspiration.
Whatever could you be talking about, Kapitan?
... Vielleicht. I'll take some photographs and think on it.
There's something I needed to talk to you about. It's about the crew.
Ah. This again?
I've heard you've been causing problems again-
*ALARM*
Can we talk about this later? *Diese Nixen müssen wie Hunde gejagt werden.*
... Fine. Get rid of the damn mist.
Jawohl!
@BATTLE
Heyyyyy, Deutschland, have you got a second?
Verschwinde!
Well, uh, it seems there's been a mix-up! Nothing personal, but-
Warum redet es noch mit mir? Verschwinde!
Look- I just want to clear the air, okay? There's been a big, big misunderstanding.
Es haben zehn Sekunden. Talk.
I'm not Jewish, Deutschland. It shouldn't matter that I'm not, but-
Es hat versagt. Schade.
Will you LISTEN to me?!
... Ah. Kapitän.
Good grief. What's going on?
This *Kakerlake* is bothering me. I've told it to go away and it won't listen.
Do you hear her, Captain?!

Fields.MenuText: Goldstein - calm down. I'll handle this.
Deutschland, for the love of... this is no way to treat your companions.
You're being completely ridiculous!

Fields.DialogueText: Ich bin NICHT.
You're telling *me* to calm down?! This is ludicrous!
I know. I know. But we can't sort this out if people are shouting-
She's not my companion!
She's dead weight. She's dragging us all down-
Don't you see, Captain-
We are in the middle of a *crisis*. We need the best soldiers we can get. Not *rats* who will sink the *ship*-
*ALARM*
Deutschland, this is *unacceptable*.
... Ja, Kapitan. The Morganas are upon us.
And we'll deal with them. But you can't keep doing this.
I understand, Captain.
Do you, really?
@BATTLE
You keep defying my orders.
Ach ja?
I told you you have to be polite to the crew. Regardless of race, creed, or nationality.
That *was* me being polite.
Is *that* so.
I've been ignoring the roach aboard. Would you prefer I try to squash it?

Fields.MenuText: She isn't even Jewish.
Absolutely not. I'd prefer you to be *professional*.
You're acting like a *child*, Val.

Fields.DialogueText: I am acting like an adult. A *disgusted* adult.
It is more *professional* not to say anything than to say what I've been thinking.
Have you seen her nose? And her hair? There's Jew blood there, beyond a doubt.
Arguing with you is like squeezing blood from sheet metal.
Good Aryan blood, I hope.
It's pointless.
So here's what's going to happen. I'm going to tell you precisely what you need to do, and you're going to do it, or face the consequences.
We can't stick any sailor you hate on a deserted island. So you have to be able to work with them.
I can't believe I'm telling a grown woman this, but you're not allowed to give your crewmates the silent treatment. You have to be polite and respectful.
Am I making myself clear?
Sehr transparent.
You're dismissed. And I'm getting an aspirin.
*ALARM*
Here, take zwei, Kapitän. I always have some Aspirin on me. And at least I'm not the biggest headache you'll have today.
Silver linings everywhere, I suppose...
@BATTLE
Oh, you 'borrowed' another one of my books.
*Die Verwandlung*, ja.
Oh, Kafka's Metamorphosis. How are you liking it?
I hate it. Abscheulich.
Why am I not surprised.
It's so neurotisch. To be expected from a Slawischen Autor. But...
But what?
... I hate it more because Gregor does not deserve this suffering.
That's kind of the point. Anyone can fall into that kind of misfortune.
No one turns into a- abscheuliches Ungeziefer. Not in real life.
Plenty of people feel like they have. Shell shock does that to you.
... Ugh. I am just glad that his sister puts him out of his misery. He's too degenerate to live by the end.
... Again, that's the point.
... You really meant that? About the... the vermin?

Fields.MenuText: Of course I did. I don't lie to you, Val.

Fields.DialogueText: ... Do you feel like that? -- Wait, what am I saying?
If you're a strong person, you shouldn't have those feelings.
"Shouldn't". You keep using that word.
And you don't?
*ALARM*
Stations, people, we got company!
Now is the time for 'should', isn't it?
Oh, hush.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: It's kind of a metaphor.

Fields.DialogueText: A metaphor for *what*?
Angst. Shell shock. Melancholy. Feelings that eat you from the inside-out.

Fields.MenuText: I think it happens to everyone sooner or later.

Fields.DialogueText: It won't *ever* happen to me! I'm *not* unclean. I keep myself pure as snow.
Mmm. Your feelings can still eat you alive.
It's always nice to get a few days of shore leave.
Yeah. Even if it's in the back end of nowhere.
I didn't know the IF even *had* a refueling station in Madagascar. You'd think it'd be somewhere a little less remote.
Well, if you get stuck in the Suez Canal, you'll need somewhere to refuel once you've gone down the coast...
I don't think I've ever given that any thought.
Well, now you have. -- Get me a souvenir while you're out, will ya?
Sure, sure. How does a handful of sand sound?

Fields.MenuText: Perfect. You know me so well.
I'd prefer a baobab cutting...
Pick me up some of the local cuisine. I'll pay you back for it.

Fields.DialogueText: Sounds fair to me.
The deal's sealed.
You gonna plant it aboard? I think we'd sink under the weight. --Though maybe that's not such a bad thing.
Yeah, yeah. I just think they're interesting.
All right. I'll be back soon, Captain.
Take care.
BRRRRM-
What the - why are the motors going?
*ALARM*
I'm trying to put some distance between us and them!
It's not like you to run away!
@BATTLE
They're still gaining on us!
Well, turn around and fight!
I'm trying to get some distance between us and them.
We're miles off course and we've barely refueled.
We can refuel in Swakopmund. That's friendly territory.
We're with the IF. The whole world's friendly territory.
Maybe it is for *you*.

Fields.MenuText: I know you're a nationalist, but this is ridiculous even for you.
Did Odin soil your breakfast again?
What's gotten into you, Val?

Fields.DialogueText: I knew you were a useful idiot, but...
Hah. Nein.
I'll tell you when we're out of the woods.
There is a storm ahead, Kapitan. And there are Nixen in that storm.
I need to concentrate.
Fine, I'll back off. For *now*.
@BATTLE
That's a *lot* of Morganas.
Keine Sorge. I will prevail.
@BATTLE
We've gone all the way around the Cape of Good Hope.
You are very good at stating the obvious, aren't you?
It doesn't seem like it was obvious to you. We're nearly out of gas.
You had better have a *damn* good reason for this.
We're about to make port. Save your breath for when we do.

Fields.MenuText: Oh, I'll save my breath.
I'll see to our landing.
Why do I get the feeling you had ulterior motives for this?

Fields.DialogueText: Are you going to yell at me, Kapitan?
Loud enough to wake the dead.
You do that.
You should know me better than that, Kapitan. I *always* have a higher goal.
You almost make it sound noble.
I want an explanation, Val.
And you'll get it, once we're refuelling.
What the HELL, Deutschland?!
As I told you: I needed to put some space between us and them.
I thought you meant the *Morganas*. Not your own *crew*.
They're *not* my *crew*. The ones I left behind are vermin-
They're your *crew*. The Fleet assigned them to us for a *reason*.
They assigned them to us because you've told the world you'll take any warm body that-
*ENOUGH.*

Fields.MenuText: Did you get *hit* in the *head*, or are you always this dense?
You do not. Insult. My crew.
It doesn't matter whether they're stupid and weak or the best gunner in the Fleet. Which, for the record, Goldstein may well be.

Fields.DialogueText: It is not an insult if it's the truth-
She *can't* be. Don't exaggerate.
Natürlich nicht! I'm as sane as you are.
We've been over this. Multiple times. And you continue to defy me.
You're defying *direct orders*.
I... I *can't* follow this order.
Not without to riskieren to be taken außer Dienst by the Kriegsmarine. And you know that!
The Kriegsmarine have signed on to the INPF mandate, however unhappily. And *you* can't disobey orders and escape the consequences.
... Which are?
... I'm still figuring that out.
*ALARM*
You can't punish me *too* harshly.
And why's that?
You need me to deal with the Nixen.
@BATTLE
Oh, you've got the gramophone going again. More Wagner?
Ja. Ich versuche, mein Herz mit nordischem Mut zu füllen! -- And the Ritt der Walküren helps me become brave.
You've got no shortage of bravery.
When it comes to glorious battle? Yes. When it comes to writing letters? That's a little more difficult.
Oh, that's right. You got a letter from the Kriegsmarine last week. I thought it was just about your photos.
Nein, nein. We're going to be passing by the German coast soon. A few of our admirals are having a dinner.
They have invited us- UND der Führer. And they want to hold it aboard my deck-
Absolutely *not*.
Was ist? But- Kapitan-
Your actions have consequences. I was willing to tolerate your ideology as long as it was all talk.
But I am *not* going to indulge your hatred. Especially not when you *abandoned a crew member* over it.
Kapitan, I might never get this chance again-

Fields.MenuText: Tough luck.
You should have thought about that before *abandoning* your *crewmate*.
The answer is no. Nein. Non. Nada-

Fields.DialogueText: Sie können in so vielen Sprachen Nein sagen, wie Sie möchten. Es wird nicht weniger weh tun.
I know it hurts. Because it's a *punishment*.
... It was the *moral* thing to do.
Is that so?
You're so callous!
You haven't even given me the chance to defend my actions.
*ALARM*
Fine. After this bout, I'll let you explain.
Dann lass uns schnell kämpfen. Machen wir kurzen Prozess.
@BATTLE
Well? Start explaining.
... The vermin in our crew are making us weaker.
It is unfair to the rest of the crew to keep them aboard, nein?
And we had *just* landed on a sparsely populated island.
Well, the Madagaskarplan has been brought up by others of the-

Fields.MenuText: Madagascar Plan?
That's disgusting, Val.
... Sheesh. You're *inimitable.*

Fields.DialogueText: You say that like it's a bad thing.
Why is *your* disgust fine, but *mine* is-
Mine is fine because I didn't *strand someone on a remote island*!
It's a proposed solution to the Jewish Question.
Good grief.
Transport all the vermin and degenerates to somewhere they won't disrupt racial harmony.
... Isn't Madagascar a *French* colony?
Yes, but that didn't bother the Engländer. Or the Polen. Or the Holländer. Or the Japaner. Or...
In this case? It *absolutely* is.
*sigh*
I've heard you out.
And?
This is still completely insane, Val. Batshit insane.
And I'm not protecting you from the consequences of your actions. You're getting full military discipline.
*ALARM*
...after the battle, I hope?
After the battle. Yes.
@BATTLE
It's a huge Insel. With plenty of Resourcen! Andere INPF-Mitglieder denken ebenso!
Was um alles in der Welt ist das?
What does it look like to you?
... It looks like ... several vats of potatoes.
That's correct, yes. One cubic meter. About seven bathtubs' worth.
And this is going to be one leg of your punishment for abandoning your crewmates.
... How are *potatoes* going to be a punishment?
You are going to peel every one of these potatoes.
... I think I must have misheard you, Kapitan. I thought you said I was going to be peeling a cubic metre of potatoes.
That's correct.
That's, what, five thousand potatoes?
More or less. All for today's lunch and night watch.
You will also not be attending the admirals' party... *and*... we will be turning around and going back for your crewmates. Immediately.
Das ist nicht dein Ernst!
Deutschland. Listen to me.
There is *no* other form of military discipline that I can give you. Nothing that wouldn't be too little or too much.
We both know I can't confine you to your quarters. I can't keep you in drydock.
But this isn't a trivial offense. Not to me, not to the INPF, and absolutely not to the rest of your crew.
... You're saying you're trying to protect me.
... I'm *furious* at what you've done. But I'm not giving up on you yet.
... Danke. So, potatoes.
Yes. Maybe by the time you get to the bottom of them, you'll have had time to think about what you've done.
... I understand, Kapitan.
I really, really hope you do.

Fields.MenuText: Something like that. Yes.
I can't protect you from yourself. But...
I protect my *crew*, Val. And whether I like it or not, that includes you.

Fields.DialogueText: *ALARM*
Perhaps we could use the potatoes as a weapon? Eine Kartoffelkanone-
Don't push your luck.
@BATTLE
Do you know what it does to their morale to know that their Belle is willing to abandon hard workers because she thinks they "look Jewish?"
I am not exaggerating when I say you could be the first ship in the INPF to spark a mutiny. I don't think we want to test how well Belle powers hold up in those conditions.
Mm... Ich danke dir for inviting me to lunch, Kapitän.
It's no problem. If we're going to discuss something heavy, it might as well be over a good meal.
Here, give me your drinking horn?
... This has got to be the freshest water I've ever tasted. Where's it from?
The Alps.
Ah, I should have realized. Es schmeckt nach Vaterland.
... What was the 'heavy' thing you wanted to discuss?
... A Walkure gets to choose her Captain. Yes?
So ist es. ....Where are you going with this?
... It might be time for you to consider choosing a different Captain.
Wie bitte?
There have got to be Captains who would be... more accepting of your ideology. I know most Kriegsmarine captains would welcome you with open arms.
... You said you weren't giving up on me.
I'm not saying I am. But it's been pointed out to me that where I had you peeling potatoes over Goldstein a fair percentage of the Kriegsmarine officer corps might have put you up for a citation.
... You take every mongrel that shows up on your doorstep, and I do wonder if you might not come to regret it. But you know, those other Kapitäne are missing something you never will lack...
And what might that be?
Take a guess.

Fields.MenuText: I'm useful to you in ways they wouldn't be.
I have a certain je ne sais quoi.
I care about *you* as a person.

Fields.DialogueText: Very funny, Kapitan. You really don't know?
You understand me better than I gave you credit for.
... Das glaube ich nicht.
... You hate everything I stand for. But you do treat me like an expert when it comes to dealing with Morganas.
You trust me to acquit myself well, even when I make mistakes. You let me pursue my passions to a degree most other Kapitäne would **not**.
Your photography?
Meine Photographien, meine Oper, meine Freiübungen.... if I asked you to let me sew and put up Reichsflaggen, you probably would.
Technically, as per INPF guidelines, we fly two of them at any given time. If you wanted more... yeah, if it kept you out of trouble, maybe I would.
Exakt. Es ist sehr verwirrend. But my point is...
You may only give me an inch. But I can *take* that inch. I can make it a mile if I have to.
You're *useful*. Another Kapitan might not be.
... Thanks. I think.
I really, really don't understand it. But I'm not going to complain about it.
It's simple. I care about my crew. You're crew.
I want you to be happy and live your best life, regardless of what you believe. Because you're one of my people. I take care of you.
... And that's the *exact* reason we're going back for Goldstein.
Eugh. Don't remind me.
*ALARM*
Well. Hunting Nixen is an important part of my best life.
It sure is. Want to grab your camera?
Even while I'm being punished?
A photo op like this doesn't come by often.
You *spoil* me, Kapitan.
@BATTLE
I think that's garbage, but it's what it is.
My main concern is beating the Morganas, and if you think that you could accomplish that more effectively with a captain and crew with which you were more in sync...
You've started in on your potato peeling, I see.
Mm. It's tedious.
That's the point. ...Is that your camera bag?
Ja. Is there a problem?
Why'd you bring your camera bag along?
Some of these potatoes have very interesting shapes.
Once they're peeled, they're almost pure white under a flashlight. They really stand out against a black background, nein?
Light and shadow is the essence of photography.
So you're photographing the potatoes instead of peeling them?
In addition to. My hands start to cramp up after too long with the knife.

Fields.MenuText: The more photos you take, the longer your punishment will be.
I don't see any problem with that.
This is meant to be a punishment. If your hands cramp, it reminds you why you're doing this.

Fields.DialogueText: And if my hands cramp too much, I'll be out of action. Let me give them a break.
Ja, dessen bin ich mir bewusst. What was it you said, the natural consequences of my actions?
As ever, you're a Schwächling.
And you say that *so* affectionately.
*ALARM*
Well, it looks like you get a break from peeling either way.
I'm *almost* grateful.
@BATTLE
How go the potatoes?
Nnnnnnn.
That's about what I thought. I hope you're learning your lesson.
Es sind nicht nur die Kartoffeln.
Really? Then what's got you down?
Can't you feel it in the air? There's a storm coming.
Wir rennen direkt in die Sturmfront. And it's a *big* one.
....Mm. Belle magic strikes again?
If you can call a headache "magic," sure.
Well. I'm sorry about the headache, but I can't feel too bad for you...
... Nicht?
If *someone* hadn't left their crewmate behind, *someone* wouldn't have to go back around the Cape.
... I am fully aware I made a mistake, Kapitan. There's no need to ride around on it.

Fields.MenuText: It's just the natural consequences of your actions.
This isn't riding.
I will ride around on it until you know what the mistake you made *is*.

Fields.DialogueText: ... You may not understand the idiom.
And I imagine so are the seven bathtubs full of potatoes?
And what mistake did I make?
You tell me.
Those are the natural consequences of pissing off your Captain.
That's certainly possible.
*ALARM*
Urgh. I hate Nixen im Sturm.
They hate us, too.
@BATTLE
Storm's cleared up.
Mm.
You have something you're supposed to be doing.
Ja, ja.
... Kapitan?
Was ist?
Hah. You can learn.
... Seriously. What is it? You look like someone filled your skirt with ants.
... We *are* operating at reduced capacity.

Fields.MenuText: That's what happens when you ditch your crew with no replacements lined up.
Yes. We're short our best gunner.
No use crying over spilled milk. We beat them, and that's what matters.

Fields.DialogueText: If you're satisfied with my performance, I shouldn't complain. But I could have done better.
You're exaggerating. Aber... we have found no replacements.
Ich weiss. Ich *weiss*. Ich hätte das nicht tun sollen.
... I expected that with the vermin no longer aboard, we'd find... something. I don't know.
Evidence of sabotage. Deliberate slacking. I thought I'd be performing better.
Well, you're not. So what does that tell you?
... Irgendwo ist mir ein Fehler unterlaufen. *Something* was wrong with my assumptions.
Can you guess what that might be?
Do you know what a leading question is, Kapitan?
*ALARM*
Damn. They brought reinforcements.
We'll have to fight them off.
At reduced capacity.
@BATTLE
Ja, ja.
Hm, that's funny...
Hein? Was ist?
I would have thought you'd have made more of a dent in the potatoes by now. That's, what...
Fifteen potatoes peeled, tops? And you've been working for the better part of three days on this.
We ran into that storm, and I had a headache. And then we ran into Fire.
That's five potatoes in an entire day. Morganas aside...
It's a slow process. I want to get them perfect.
...Is that a full roll of film, there?
What if it is?
I see. I'll be taking this, then. And this... and this-
Nein! Nicht meine Kameratasche!
What? You're photographing the potatoes instead of peeling them. I'm taking away the temptation.
My camera is my soul, Kapitan. Please-

Fields.MenuText: I'll keep it safe until you're done, don't worry.
I'm not going to crush your spirit. Much.
Hey, this is what you get for being slow.

Fields.DialogueText: I am not too slow!
That was *not* funny, Kapitan.
Do you think that's reassuring?!
Your camera stays with me until you get the potatoes dealt with.
Ich hasse dich.
If you hate me *that* much, you can always change Captains.
*ALARM*
In a *battle*, I've never had a better one.
You're only awful at *peace*.
If you need a fight, you've got one.
@BATTLE
Val? What are you doing?
What does it look like I'm doing, Kapitan?
I'm not sure. You've got a washcloth and rolled up sleeves...
I am doing kitchen duty! As the Walküre of this Schiff, I must set a good example-
Kitchen duty.
Ja.
Funny thing about kitchen duty.
I don't see any potatoes around here. Do you?
I'm sure there are some in the Messe.
They're all back in the storeroom. --Do you know who was supposed to be on KP duty this week?
Lass mich raten. Goldstein?
The very same. And since she's unable to carry out her duties, you know who they fall on?
Natürlich mich. It is the natural consequences of my actions-
As the Captain, since she can't carry out her duties, they fall to me. So *you* are free to carry out your *other* assigned duties.
Warum um alles in der Welt würdest du das tun?

Fields.MenuText: Because I'm responsible for the safety of my crew.
Because you don't get to turn your *punishment* into a battle of wills.
Because I don't hate cleaning the kitchen, and other people have things to do.

Fields.DialogueText: Jawohl. That is more than true.
Everything is a battle of wills, Kapitan.
I thought you said you were drowning in paperwork? Werde ein besserer Lügner.
*ALARM*
... Well, it looks like you'll get that break after all.
Ich werde sie zerstören. Oder sie zerstören die Galeere.
Either way, you win?
Eben, Kapitän.
@BATTLE
Oh dear.
Was ist?
This is getting ridiculous.
I have no idea what you mean.
You're sitting in the cockpit of a seaplane...
Ja?
Holding a single potato...
Und? You didn't say I had to peel all the potatoes in the galley, did you?

Fields.MenuText: I thought you prided yourself on your efficiency.
What if I needed you for something?
I didn't, but maybe I should have.

Fields.DialogueText: Then you would have found me. Just as you did now.
Mm. Is that an order, Kapitän?
The only thing more important than efficiency is *power*, Kapitän.
Can you force me to follow this order? Can you *force* me to accept this punishment?
If you cannot... you cannot punish me. There is nothing you can do to me.
There is. I just don't want to go that far.
*ALARM*
Our enemies don't share your restraint.
Let's hope that makes them easier to kill.
@BATTLE
Ugh. I have more red tape to get through today than Val has potatoes. My in-tray is screaming.
Where do I even begin...

Fields.MenuText: Start with reports for back home.
Reports for the Kriegsmarine...
Reports for the League. Goodness, there's a thousand of these things.

Fields.DialogueText: *THUMP*
Ack!
Deutschland! Did you just dump-
My allotment of potatoes onto your desk? Jawohl, Kapitän!
I can't *believe* you.
There's paperwork and potatoes everywhere! My entire cabin's a mess-
You said you wanted me where you could see me. I obliged.
Out.
What?
Get out of my office *now*.
*pop*
... She teleported away. I'm never gonna get used to them doing that...
Now I have to clean up all these potatoes-
*ALARM*
Great. Another mess to clean up.
@BATTLE
*pop*
Where are all the peeling knives coming from? Val? Are you threatening your captain with peeling knives?
*pop* *pop*
*scrape* *scrape*
Belle magicking the potatoes into peeling themselves isn't going to-
Val? Val, where are you?
Val... we need to talk...
Hey! I was looking for you-
*POP*
Urgh.
Val, if you don't come out, I'm going to have to use the PA. We *need* to talk.
You told me to go away. I'm *gone*.
PA it is.
Deutschland? This is your Captain speaking.
First, an announcement for the crew: for lunch today, we're going to have a wide selection of potato products.
These will include *pickert*, *himmel und erde*, colcannon, boxty, sausage and potato curry-
You're bluffing. Das gäbe eine Meuterei.
I knew that would get you listening. Where are you?
Ich bin nicht erreichbar.
Fair. I just want to talk.
Then talk. I won't stop you.
Deutschland... I wanted to talk about your punishment. Privately. But if this is how we're going to do it-
Ich kann dich nicht aufhalten. Just say it.
Fine. If this is how it's gonna be, this is how it's gonna be.
Look, V- Deutschland. I didn't want to punish you for the sake of punishing you.
I don't want to make you suffer because you made a mistake. Even if it's a *huge* goddamn mistake.
... But we both have a duty to our crew. Me as Captain, and you as Belle. And you and I both failed in that duty.
I wanted you to do something that would *help* the crew.  Like, say, feed them.
Remind you of your duty to them. Remind you why we do this. And ... give you some time to think about how you want to treat them in the future.
... Kapitan...

Fields.MenuText: We all have our part to play. I needed you to remember yours.
I failed them as much as you did. We both needed time to reflect on that.
This cannot happen again. I needed you to take the time to understand *why.*

Fields.DialogueText: ... It's true. I did not do everything I should have.
I think I understand. ...And I am willing to take the time to think more.
... You admit your failings to your subordinates?
Leadership's a matter of trust, isn't it?
So you will be finishing your potatoes, then?
Glad we're on the same page.
... You *did* promise the crew some himmel und erde.
... I trust that my leaders will be strong.
There's a lot of different kinds of strength, aren't there?
... I'll have to think about that.
Good. I knew I could count on you.
... You really just wanted me to think about this? You didn't want to humiliate me more?
I thought you'd need a lot of time to think.
Jawohl, Kapitän.
That's what I like to hear.
*ALARM*
... Time for a different kind of thinking.
It's the one you're best at.
@BATTLE
We've contacted the proper authorities. Goldstein's coming home.
... I see.
I can't lie, I'm ... relieved.
Oh?
Das Trauerspiel dauert schon viel zu lange. I will be glad to put it behind us.
Me too.
... I am considering apologizing to Goldstein.

Fields.MenuText: Who are you and what have you done with Deutschland?
I think that's a great idea.
It's the least you could do.

Fields.DialogueText: I am still myself, Kapitän. But you gave me some time to think. And I thought.
... As I said, I want to put this behind us.
I expected you would. ...
What?
Look- here she comes.
Nothing.
Welcome back, Goldstein. I hope you enjoyed your "shore leave".
It was fine. I got sunburnt. You really didn't waste any time getting back here, did you?
Nope. You're part of my crew.
I have something to say.
Huh? What is it?
I'm- I'm-
(Oh dear.)
Es tut mir leid. I am *sorry*!
... Wait, what?
I should not have assumed you were *vermin* without doing my due diligence.
... Uh. Thanks.
... Didn't expect *you* to apologize.
... As the Kapitän said. You're part of our crew.
I should not have abandoned you. I failed at my duty.
It will not happen again.
It better not. But... I accept your apology.
Really?
Yeah. ... It's more than I expected from you.
*ALARM*
Places, everyone! --You ready to get back to work?
Born ready, Captain!
@BATTLE
You wanted to see me?
Yeah. I needed to tell you-
While I was cooling my heels, I put in a request for re-assignment. Next time we make port, I'm gonna be transferring.

Fields.MenuText: In your shoes, I'd do the same.
You're a good soldier. I hate to lose you.
Sorry it had to come to this.

Fields.DialogueText: Thanks for understanding, Cap'. I knew I could count on you.
Me too. I could have liked it here. She's got the best guns I've ever fired. And...
It's what I'm here for.
I hate to go. I really could have liked it here.
You're living up to your reputation, and you're doing amazing work out here. I hate to leave you behind.
It's just- this goddamn *Belle*-
I hear you. Believe me, I hear you.
My whole family's Navy lifers. I never wanted to do anything else, and when this war gave me the chance to get my hands dirty... God help me, there was a part of me that was actually grateful.
And then I had some time away- and I knew what I had to do.
Well, maybe you'll get transferred to a different ship in my command.
Here's to hoping.
*ALARM*
Guess you get one more fight under my command.
Let's make it a good one.
@BATTLE
But being aboard *her*? I couldn't stop thinking about jumping ship.
Hey, Deutschland. No gramophone today?
Nein. I needed quiet for my opera.
Oh. Well, I won't keep you.
Don't be a fool. I like your company.
Of course. How's it coming along?
The libretto eludes me. But I will meistern it.
You don't have to master your own writing, do you?
I would like to get to the music sometime this century. But I need the libretto first.
Couldn't you collaborate with someone? They could write the text, and you could do the music.
Wagner wrote his own libretto, and so shall I.
Wagner wasn't fighting a world war.
He was also human. I am not.
If you're not human, how can you be the master race?
Sehr witzig, Kapitän.
I'm just asking!
I am the culmination of everything my Volk has to offer the world. All of their hopes, all of their vision, all of their might. I am the triumph of their will.

Fields.MenuText: And yet you're stuck on a bit of poetry.
And all their fears?
Maybe you're right. But maybe you're more than that.

Fields.DialogueText: How could I be more than that?
Chew on that, see what you come up with.
Pah. It will come to me eventually.
What is that supposed to mean?
You're the triumph of their will, and yet you're running scared from one girl because you thought she had genetic cooties.
I was not *scared*. I wanted to be more *efficient.*
It's going to be more nonsense about the brotherhood of man, isn't it?
If you're just going to make noise at me, you can leave. I need to finish this.
Maybe I can help. What's the problem?
Finishing it. I don't know how my Walküre should triumph.
In a story about Ragnarök... die Götterdämmerung... no one can win. But I can't make this a tragedy.
Why not?
Does it matter? I *can't*.
Does it have to be about Ragnarok?
*Yes*.
I know what I want to put into the world. The tree has flowered. But it won't bear fruit.
Maybe you need to pollinate it. Read more books, broaden your horizons a little more.
A *completely selfless* suggestion with *no* ulterior motives.
It's a suggestion. Take it or leave it.
The problem is not my horizons. Man muss sich überwinden, um gut zu schreiben.
"Man must conquer himself to write well?"
Exactly.
If you're writing about a Valkyrie... maybe your problem is that you don't know your enemy?
*ALARM*
Don't be stupid, Kapitän. I know *these* enemies.
Never said you didn't.
@BATTLE
It's quiet today.
After the farewell party? I think everyone's a little hung over.
Bah. If they didn't drink, they wouldn't be hung over.
That may be so. But everyone needs to celebrate from time to time.
They can do it without making themselves sick.
Mm.
Kapitan? I have to ask you something.
Fire away.
... When you said you failed in your duty to the crew, what exactly did you mean?
Oh, that. It's complicated, you know?
I need to hear it.
You've shown weakness. If we're to keep fighting together, I must correct it.
I guess I can tell you. It won't really change anything.

Fields.MenuText: I failed to protect the rest of my crew from you.
I failed to inspire everyone. We're supposed to work together, despite ideology.
I failed to understand you. If I'd known you'd go *that* far to keep your ship "pure"...

Fields.DialogueText: Is that really how you think of it?
I didn't want to. You're our Belle. You're as much a part of the crew as anyone else.
You crossed a line. And you made it very clear you were going to cross it. I should have seen the warning signs.
I'd go further.
I won't give you the chance.
That's not possible. You can't trust-
You said you wanted to hear me out. So hear me out.
You *literally* abandoned members of your crew. But I wasn't there when they needed me. I abandoned them too.
Abandoned them to a few days of rest on a tropical island. If that's your only failure, you're not such a bad Kapitän.
I wish I could take that as a compliment.
That's how it was meant.
Anyway. ...You have nothing to fear from me on that front. I won't abandon a crewmate again.
Good. I wish that was all I was worried about.
... People don't leave ships. They leave their commanders.
What's that supposed to mean?
You keep this up, you won't be able to keep a crew. You're getting a reputation.
I only want the best.
You won't get them. You'll just get the ones who think like you.
They're the same, aren't they?
If you keep this up, we'll find out.
